TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the applicant , may be summarised as follows .

In DATE the applicant was dismissed from the army for political reasons . In DATE he was again admitted as a professional soldier . In accordance with the governmental Regulation No . CARDINAL , in conjunction with LAW of DATE , the period during which the applicant had been prevented , for political reasons , from serving as a professional soldier was to be considered as a period of service in the army when determining his salary and pension entitlements .

On DATE the Pecuniary Entitlements of Soldiers Act of DATE entered into force . It provided , in LAW , that the above Regulation No . DATE should not be applicable in respect of professional soldiers . As a result , the applicant ’s salary and pension entitlements were considerably diminished since their amount depended on the period of time during which he had served in the army .

On DATE ORG confirmed to the applicant , with reference to the Pecuniary Entitlements of Soldiers Act of DATE , that the period during which he had been prevented from serving in the army could no longer be taken into account when determining his salary and pension rights .

On DATE the president of a parliamentary committee confirmed the position to the applicant . The letter further stated that the members of the committee would consider the possibility of initiating an amendment to the relevant law .

On DATE the applicant complained to ORG that the relevant statutory provisions were discriminatory . On CARDINAL DATE a constitutional judge informed the applicant that individuals lacked standing to bring proceedings with a view to having the conformity of a law with the LAW or with an international treaty determined . The letter concluded that ORG could not entertain the applicant ’s complaint .
On DATE a judge of ORG informed the applicant that ORG lacked jurisdiction to make general comments on legal rules .

On DATE ORG admitted , in reply to the applicant ’s complaint , that there was an inconsistency between the Pecuniary Entitlements of Soldiers Act of DATE and LAW of DATE , and that the relevant provisions had to be brought into conformity with LAW . The applicant was further informed that it was expected that ORG would initiate a legislative amendment with a view to resolving the problem .

The applicant requested ORG to bring proceedings with a view to having the alleged conflict between the Pecuniary Entitlements of Soldiers Act of DATE and the LAW determined by ORG . On DATE ORG informed the applicant that his request had been transmitted to ORG .
On DATE the applicant retired from the army .
Regulation No . CARDINAL

In accordance with LAW . CARDINAL governing the salaries of persons employed by public organisations , employers are entitled to take into account the period during which a person was prevented from exercising his or her profession for reasons of political persecution as a period of activity in the relevant field for the purpose of determining the length of the professional experience of the person concerned .
Pecuniary Entitlements of Soldiers Act of DATE

Section CARDINAL of the Act on Pecuniary Entitlements of Soldiers ( Zákon o peňažných náležitostiach vojakov ) provided that Regulation No . CARDINAL ceased to be applicable in respect of professional soldiers from the moment of the entry into force of that Act on DATE .

As from DATE the LAW was amended . As a result , LAW ( CARDINAL ) provides that the time which is to be considered as period of employment under special laws , such as LAW , shall be included , in case of professional soldiers , in the overall duration of their service in the army .
LAW of DATE
LAW ( Zákon o vojenskej službe ) was adopted on DATE and it entered into force on DATE . It governs the legal aspects of the exercise of military service and its cessation .

Section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) provides that all periods of time during which a person was considered to have served in the army under rules in force prior to the enactment of LAW of DATE shall be included in the overall duration of such a person ’s military service when determining his or her entitlements under that Act .
Constitutional provisions and practice

Pursuant to LAW , as in force at the relevant time , the ORG shall review the challenges to final decisions made by central government authorities , local government authorities and local self - government bodies in cases concerning violations of fundamental rights and freedoms of citizens , unless the protection of such rights falls under the jurisdiction of another court .
LAW , as in force at the relevant time , provides as follows :
“ CARDINAL . The Constitutional Court shall commence proceedings upon a proposal submitted by :
a ) CARDINAL of all members of ORG ;
b ) the President of GPE ;
c ) the Government of GPE ;
d ) a court ;
e ) the General Prosecutor ;
f ) any person whose rights shall be adjudicated pursuant to LAW .
CARDINAL . ORG may commence proceedings upon a petition submitted by legal entities or individuals claiming a violation of their rights . ”

In accordance with its established practice , the Constitutional Court lacks jurisdiction to examine a petition under LAW ) of the LAW when the determination of the point in issue involves the preliminary question of conflict of legal rules ( for example , NORP ÚS CARDINAL/CARDINAL , decision of DATE ) .
